title.narrative: Improve access to basic and emergencies health services for vulnerable people (refugees, IDPs, and host population), and reinforcing epidemic control through diseases surveillance in Tillabery and Tahoua Health Regions.

description.narrative: The main objective of this WHO project is to provide access to emergency health care for IDPs and host population in 10 health districts in the Tillabery region and 2 health districts in Tahoua region. WHO will provide a minimum package of primary health care services and a minimum package of complementary secondary services to approximately 463,000 individuals including 390 000 children. WHO will also train 180 health workers in the 12 health districts of Tillabery and Tahoua region, to improve their knowledge and implementation of the minimum health service package of activities in emergency situations. Some 463,000 individuals will be assisted over 9 months.
